title: 中国对美国相关模拟芯片发起反倾销调查，就集成电路领域美方措施发起反歧视调查
title\_zh: 中国对美国相关模拟芯片发起反倾销调查，就集成电路领域美方措施发起反歧视调查
source: RFI（法国国际广播电台 华语） / 商务部公告（通过微信公众号或转载）
summary\_en: On Sept. 13, 2025 China’s Ministry of Commerce announced two linked actions: (1) an anti-dumping investigation into certain U.S.-origin analog integrated-circuit (IC) chips — specifically commodity interface ICs and gate driver ICs using 40nm and above — with the dumping investigation period set as Jan 1–Dec 31, 2024 and the injury period as Jan 1, 2022–Dec 31, 2024; the case was filed by the Jiangsu Semiconductor Industry Association and the applicant’s preliminary evidence claims imports rose \~37% while import prices fell \~52%. (2) a separate anti-discrimination investigation into U.S. measures targeting China’s integrated-circuit sector; the ministry framed these steps as a legal response to U.S. export controls and discriminatory restrictions and said it will “take all necessary measures to defend the legitimate rights and interests of Chinese companies.” The anti-dumping probe normally should conclude by Sept 13, 2026 (with a possible six-month extension). ([商务部][1])
summary\_zh: 2025年9月13日，中国商务部宣布两项相关行动：一是对原产于美国的部分模拟集成电路（主要为使用40nm及以上工艺的通用接口芯片和栅极驱动芯片）立案反倾销调查，倾销调查期为2024年1月1日至2024年12月31日，产业损害调查期为2022年1月1日至2024年12月31日；该案由江苏省半导体行业协会提出，申请人提交的初步证据称2022–2024年相关自美进口量累计增长约37%，进口价格累计下降约52%。二是就美国对华集成电路领域相关措施启动反歧视调查，中方将此作为对美方出口管制和限制性措施的法律回应，并表示“将采取一切必要措施捍卫中国企业的正当权益”。反倾销调查通常应在2026年9月13日前结束，特殊情况下可延长6个月。([商务部][1])
best\_quote\_en: China said it will “take all necessary measures to defend the legitimate rights and interests of Chinese companies.” ([商务部][2])
